definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: The president's attempt to correct governmental abuses is successful.
sentences.chinese: 总统为匡正政府弊端而做的努力颇有成效。

sentences.english: Wherever there is injustice, we try to help.
sentences.chinese: 凡有不公正的地方，我们都竭力相助匡正。

sentences.english: It is a forceful rectification of the traditional literary concept.
sentences.chinese: 这是对传统文学观的一次有力匡正。

sentences.english: All the ills of democracy can be cured by more democracy.
sentences.chinese: 民主制度的缺点要用更民主来匡正。

sentences.english: Readers are requested to make the corrections pointed out in the errata.
sentences.chinese: 要求读者根据勘误表匡正。

sentences.english: This paper tries to correct some of these errors in this book.
sentences.chinese: 本文仅就其中的一些失误试作匡正。

definition: Jente township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to remonstrate/to warn earnestly (esp. classical written Chinese)/to exhort
laws and discipline of imperial court
to encourage the free airing of views (idiom)
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
lit. drain away filth and bring in fresh water (idiom); fig. dispel evil and usher in good/eliminate vice and exalt virtue
